results.title: Do or die = The Rubicon
results.creator_credit: Rowan Woods, Lavinia Warner, John Edwards, Warner Sister Film and TV Ltd, British Sky Broadcasting, Southern Star Entertainment and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: A British-Australia co-production, “Do or die” is a 2 part mini series about the plight of a British mother to reconnect with a past lover from Australia who holds the key to her son’s mortality. When a car hits Sam and Nicky’s son, their lives are thrown into turmoil when tests discover he has leukaemia and neither of the parents is an exact match and life saving donor—he is not Nicky’s son. Sam discloses that when backpacking as a teenager with her friend in Australia, she became involved with Michael Tyler, a known bank robber who was eventually caught and imprisoned by Detective Daryl Quint, but whom escapes after Sam returns to Australia to try and persuade him to save their child. Quint, convinced that Sam and Michael still have feelings for one another, charges her with being an accomplice after she is forced to drive Michael away following an arranged meeting intercepted by the police. A veritable hot bed of beaches, slow tracking, swanky looking Sydney city shots and dogged law enforcement as represented by Quint (McInnes), the cast includes Tom Long, Kate Ashfield, Hugo Speer, William McInnes and Martin Sacks. Directed by Rowan Woods (The Boys), who has made a career out of directing for the small screen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rowan Woods, Lavinia Warner, John Edwards, Warner Sister Film and TV Ltd, British Sky Broadcasting, Southern Star Entertainment and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: Do not pass go
results.creator_credit: Phil de Montingnie, Kent Chadwick and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the story of two young people and their confrontation with the law. Set in the streets, in the children’s courts and in the prisons, it shows that Australian welfare systems do not necessarily assist such teenagers. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Do not fold, staple, spindle, or mutilate
results.creator_credit: John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Written by New York playwright Millard Lampell and starring Hollywood’s Ed Begley, this film tells the story of an aging union leader who, after a lifetime of service for the cause, finds that he has outlived his usefulness and esteem among the workers of his factory, that times have changed and a new strategy is needed in bargaining with the company. It is the situation of a man who must retire.

results.title: Doctors and nurses
results.creator_credit: Maurice Murphy, Brian Rosen, Finn Productions and Universal Entertainment
results.brief_description: Comedy in which roles are reversed in a children’s hospital so that the children are in control and diagnosing the problems of “childish” adults.

results.title: Do I have to kill my child?
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Janet Isaac, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A program which dramatises the anguish and desperation of parents who turn baby-bashers. Jackie Weaver plays Dianne, a young, middle class mother whose ability to cope with children, neighbours, the housework and upward-mobile husband and all the stresses of modern living suddenly gives way. A warm, dramatic film about a very real problem in contemporary society. Cast include: Jacki Weaver, Brendon Lunney, Willie Fennell.

results.title: DNA
results.creator_credit: Bane Jovanovic and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The likeness of an offspring to its parents, whatever the species, has been traced to a unique molecule that controls the production of proteins and transmits characteristics. This genetic material, dioxyribonucleic acid, or DNA - the hereditary material of life - is described and illustrated in this film by color animation. Mutations are also discussed. A film for science students.

results.title: Djeli: Conte D'aujourd'hui = Bloodline: A Modern Tale
results.brief_description:
Fanta and Karamoko, two students from Ivory Coast, are in love and making plans to marry. They come from the same village and their families have known each other for a long time. However, Karamoko, is the son a a griot and he is not allowed to marry Fanta who descends from a noble lineage. The families oppose the union in the name of tradition.

Credits: Producer, director, Fadika Kramo-Lancine ; photography, Christian Lacoste, N’Gouan Kacou ; music, Kyate Sori Kandia.
Cast: Tatou Ouatara, Joachim Ouatara Yao

results.title: Doctor Who: the ark in space
results.creator_credit: Rodney Bennett, Philip Hinchcliffe and BBC
results.brief_description: The Doctor (Tom Baker), Sarah Jane Smith (Elisabeth Sladen) and Harry (Ian Marter) find themselves on space station Nerva - otherwise known as the Ark - where mission control appears to be sabotaged and all life forms have been cryogenically preserved in suspended animation. Sarah Jane finds herself one of the frozen chosen when she lies on a tranquilliser couch/short-range matter transmitter. When two of the Ark’s inhabitants are re-animated, med-tech Vira (Wendy Williams) and leader Noah (Kenton Moore) - they reveal that civilisation underwent mass cryogenic processing to avoid their imminent destruction by solar flares; the only problem being that their best laid plans for a programmed re-animation didn’t work due to their equipment being damaged by an unknown being. The unknown beings turn out to be The Wirrn, an insect race who have found a valuable food source on the Ark and laid it’s eggs on the solar stacks. It’s up to the Doctor to save the day. This was the second episode in which the fourth Doctor (Tom Baker 1974-1980) appeared. Originally broadcast in the UK on BBC1 between January 25 and April 15, 1975. Written by Robert Holmes.

results.title: DIY: the top 50 jobs
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Greenberg, Kat Arundel, Rob Page and Lifetime
results.brief_description: Probably the most valuable asset in our lifetime is the home we live in, so it’s well worth taking as much care of it as possible. All too often though, it’s the jobs which really need doing which seem so difficult to do yourself. It does not really seem worth bringing in the expensive professionals. Help is now at hand, “DIY - the top 50 jobs” is a practical guide aimed at beginners. It shows you how to tackle a whole range of subjects from home plumbing and electrics to painting, decorating and home security. It quite simply gives you the basic grounding and confidence to do the fifty most important jobs around the home. The subjects covered are: exterior decoration and maintenance, home security, insulation, electrics (WARNING - provides advice which does not conform to Australian Electrical Specifications and Regulations), plumbing, interior decoration, and fixtures and fittings.

results.title: Doctor Who: remembrance of the Daleks
results.creator_credit: Andrew Morgan, John Nathan-Turner and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The Doctor and Ace (Sophie Aldred) land in London, 1963, amidst an environment of mysterious magnetic fluctuation and a military stake out. Leaping in the back of scientific advisor Professor Rachel Jenson’s wagon, the time lord and his companion find themselves in the thick of a siege in which men are being killed by a mysterious “death ray”. The Doctor informs Group Captain Gilmore, the man in charge, that these are the energy weapons of the Daleks. The Daleks have come to retrieve something the first Doctor left behind at the school of his grand daughter Susan, the powerful Hand of Omega. The Daleks are species divided however, with two warring factions competing for the Hand. On one side there is Dalek Emperor Davros, on the other the renegade Imperial Dalek faction headed by the Supreme Dalek. The Doctor must stop the Daleks from gaining the Hand and protect Group Captain Gilmore and his men from extinction. Boasting more special Dalek induced effects than in previous episodes, Sylvester McCoy starred as the seventh Doctor in this 25th season of the cult series for a period of three years (1987-1989). Written by Ben Aaronovitch.
